page.title: 01Burton Upon Stather
page.content: This area is 8km NNW of Scunthorpe and is virtually bisected from north to south by the River Trent.To the east of the river on the flood plain of the Trent there is the village of Garthorpe sited on marshlands drained in the 17th century. To the west of the river the landscape is dominated by the almost sheer 65 metre high Burton Cliff.The village of Burton Upon Stather stands on the edge of the Burton Cliff overlooking the River Trent. The original village occupies the cliff top and at the foot of the cliff is Burton Stather,the site of old river wharves.
